Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): add internal compiler option to control class metadata emit
Issues.Body:
An internal compiler option named `supportTestBed` is now available for use by the Angular CLI. This option currently controls the extraction and emit of Angular class metadata. This emitted information is only needed in AOT mode when using certain TestBed APIs. However, AOT mode is currently not available for unit testing within the Angular CLI. As a result, the metadata is not used within CLI generation applications and in particular production applications. Without this option, the CLI needs to manually perform a code transform to remove the metadata and also replicate TypeScript's import eliding. This is can be a complicated operation and must be continually kept up to date with any changes to both the Angular compiler and TypeScript. The introduction of this new option alleviates these concerns.

Also includes a bonus cleanup commit that removes some leftover ngcc related code.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): add internal compiler option to control class metadata emit" (#50604)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): error when reading compiled input transforms metadata in JIT mode
Issues.Body: Fixes an error that surfaced in #50580 where the compiler was throwing an error in JIT mode when reading the result of `compileDirectiveDeclaration`. It is caused by the fact that input transform functions were being passed around directly, instead of being wrapped in an AST node.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(compiler): error when reading compiled input transforms metadata in JIT mode" (#50600)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): drop `tsickle` code paths
Issues.Body:
`tsickle` is not used in any code paths in 3P and we can remove this complexity. The `tsickle` npm package has not been released in a while and we are risking breakages with e.g. future TypeScript versions.

Note that the `ng_module` rule was updated to not emit through tsickle at all. The tsickle in 1P is done directly by `tsc_wrapped` and our code path in `compiler-cli` is not needed at all.

There might be more opportunity to clean-up the emit callback logic, but that's would better be a follow-up/needs more consideration in terms of API
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): drop `tsickle` code paths" (#50602)

Issues.Title: Add change detection strategy for directives
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

While directives are template-less components, they still register the same life cycle.

Components with multiple directives in their templates have mixed change detection strategies. The components use `OnPush` while the directives use the default one and increase the change detection time.

This is another try to start a new vote for this feature:
https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/19098



### Proposed solution

Add change detection strategy for directives to support `onPush`.

### Alternatives considered

Not using directives.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add change detection strategy for directives" (#50601)

Issues.Title: getCurrentNavigation() is null on Angular 15.. Cannot access nested route state params
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Since Angular 15, we cannot rely on `router.getCurrentNavigation().extras.state` anymore (like describe here in https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/48744), however, the alternative of using `location.getState()` doesn't work with nested childs and `skipLocationChange: true`.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-af332a?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.module.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html

1. Go to the StackBlitz.
2. Click the `Trigger error` button.
3. Notice no failure reason is shown.

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
- `router.getCurrentNavigation()` is now `null` in the `constructor`.
- `location.getState()` returns the `FooComponent` state params.

There's no actual way of getting my `failure` state params..
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
`Angular`: 15.0.2 (stackblitz), 15.2.8 (local project)
```


### Anything else?

We have nested routes for error routes and nested routes for "normal" routes in our SPA, before we could rely on `router.getCurrentNavigation().extras.state` to get the `failure` state params which we cannot do anymore..
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "getCurrentNavigation() is null on Angular 15.. Cannot access nested route state params" (#50595)

Issues.Title: Template Pipeline: Null-Safety, Attributes & Properties
Issues.Body:
Various improvements to the template pipeline, including

- Several null-safe features:
  - null-safe navigation (both property and keyed reads)
  - non-null assertions
  - initial processing of nullish coalescing
- Refactoring of attribute and property binding handling

Several of the null-safe features, such as reads of pipes or null-safe calls, will require generating temporary variables to be fully complete. This will be handled in a temporary variables pass, in a subsequent PR.

See individual commits for details.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Template Pipeline: Null-Safety, Attributes & Properties" (#50594)

Issues.Title: `toSignal` typings are incorrect
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I would like to clarify why toSignal typings are so complicated? I mean there 2 ways to declare signals and one of them is working another one is not, also it depends on the TypeScript settings for strictness

Why don't you want to declare it as a 3rd way (in sample)?

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-fngvnl?file=src%2Fmain.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

Issues.Title: Proxy fails when HTTP response contains large HTTP headers
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

15.2.8

### Description

I'm using the [dev server proxy](https://angular.io/guide/build#proxying-to-a-backend-server) to forward HTTP responses from my localhost HTTP backend to my localhost Angular application running in a browser.

Since I upgraded to Angular CLI v16, one specific response is unable to be proxied back to the browser, failing with an HTTP 500.

Running Angular CLI with an altered NodeJS option seems to solve the issue, but that's not very handy:
```
node --max-http-header-size=32768 node_modules/.bin/ng serve
```

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Generate a new Angular app with `ng new`.
2. Configure a `proxyConfig` in `angular.json`, proxying for example from `localhost:4200/api` to `localhost:8080/api`
3. Configure the backend server to respond with more than 8 kio of HTTP headers.
4. Run `ng serve`
5. Run any request that triggers the proxy redirection.
6. The proxy responds with an HTTP 500 and an "HPE_HEADER_OVERFLOW" error is printed into the terminal.

### Exception or Error

```text
[webpack-dev-server] [HPM] Error occurred while proxying request localhost:4200/api/web/diffusion-requests/search?ascending=true&orderBy=scheduledDate&pageNumber=1&pageSize=10 to http://localhost:9002/ [HPE_HEADER_OVERFLOW] (https://nodejs.org/api/errors.html#errors_common_system_errors)
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 16.0.5
Node: 18.16.0
Package Manager: npm 9.5.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 16.0.4
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1600.5
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.0.5
@angular-devkit/core            16.0.5
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.0.5
@angular/cdk                    16.0.3
@angular/cli                    16.0.5
@schematics/angular             16.0.5
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      4.9.5
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Proxy fails when HTTP response contains large HTTP headers" (#25334)

Issues.Title: Installing the CLI within 30-60 seconds after its publication to npm causes error
Issues.Body:
### Command

other

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I tried to install the `@angular/cli` package but got the following error:

```
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5123669Z npm ERR! code ETARGET
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5135901Z npm ERR! notarget No matching version found for @angular-devkit/core@16.0.5.
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5136229Z npm ERR! notarget In most cases you or one of your dependencies are requesting
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5136537Z npm ERR! notarget a package version that doesn't exist.
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5151588Z 
```

The npm cli was trying to install `@angular/cli` version `16.0.5` which has `@angular-devkit/core` version `16.0.5` as a dependency. 
The problem was that the `@angular-devkit/core` package was not published yet. 

While investigating I found out that there was a 60 second window where this could happen. 

Below is a table of publish times for both packages. You can see that the `@angular-devkit/core` package is usually published 30-60 seconds later than the cli package.

| Version         | CLI publish time     | devkit/core publish time | difference
|--------------|-----------|------------|--------|
| 16.0.0 | 2023-05-03T17:54:18.493Z | 2023-05-03T17:54:49.718Z | 31.2s |
| 16.0.1 | 2023-05-10T20:07:10.642Z | 2023-05-10T20:07:56.296Z | 45.7s |
| 16.0.2 | 2023-05-17T12:28:41.824Z | 2023-05-17T12:29:24.033Z | 42.2s |
| 16.0.3 | 2023-05-25T19:33:23.528Z | 2023-05-25T19:33:51.414Z | 27.9s |
| 16.0.4 | 2023-06-01T14:14:35.093Z | 2023-06-01T14:15:39.485Z | 64.4s |
| 16.0.5 | 2023-06-07T11:15:44.494Z | 2023-06-07T11:16:44.925Z | 60.4s |

publish times are acquired using the `npm show` command:
* `npm show @angular-devkit/core time --json`
* `npm show @angular/cli time --json`




### Minimal Reproduction

Run `npm install -g @angular/cli` within 30-60 seconds after a new package has been published.


### Exception or Error

```text
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5123669Z npm ERR! code ETARGET
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5135901Z npm ERR! notarget No matching version found for @angular-devkit/core@16.0.5.
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5136229Z npm ERR! notarget In most cases you or one of your dependencies are requesting
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5136537Z npm ERR! notarget a package version that doesn't exist.
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5151588Z
```


### Your Environment

```text
This is not relevant (ng was not installed yet)
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): improve initial file analysis for esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, the set of initially loaded files for the application is now calculated by analyzing potential transitively loading JavaScript and/or CSS files. This ensures that the full set of bundled files is available for bundle size calculations as well as further analysis in areas such as link-based hint generation in the application's index HTML.
This also fixes a bug where non-injected `scripts` where incorrectly shown as initial files.

Issues.Title: APIs for authoring bootstrap-agnostic ng add schematics
Issues.Body:
These changes add the necessary APIs that library authors can use to create `ng add` schematics that don't need to account for whether a project is NgModule-based or standalone. They're split up across a few commits to make reviewing easier. High-level description of the commits:

1. `refactor(@schematics/angular): allow for imports to be inserted under an alias` - Expands the `insertImport` utility to allow for aliases to be specified. This is necessary to avoid naming conflicts when automatically adding imports. I've also added some tests for `insertImport` since it didn't have any test coverage.
2. `refactor(@schematics/angular): add utility to find top-level identifiers` - Adds a utility that can be used to find whether a file has a top-level identifier with a specific name. Useful when trying to avoid import conflicts.
3. `feat(@schematics/angular): add bootstrap-agnostic utilities for writing ng-add schematics` - This is the commit that adds the two new `addRootImport` and `addRootProvider` utilities that library authors can use.
4. `refactor(@schematics/angular): deprecate private standalone utilities` - Marks the existing private standalone utilities as deprecated in favor of the new ones.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "APIs for authoring bootstrap-agnostic ng add schematics" (#25309)

### Description

I just updated our Angular app from version 15 to 16.

After the update completed I get the following vulnerability issue for the package: @angular-devkit/build-angular:

```
# npm audit report

vite  4.3.0 - 4.3.8
```

Issues.Title: Type check with `ngc --noEmit` results in scss import errors
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

compiler-cli, compiler

### Description

I am trying to write a CI pipeline to check our Angular app for type errors. I have come across Issue angular/angular#49194, which suggests to use `ngc --noEmit`. This solution seems to work fine, except we are using scss for our styles and this results in errors such as:
```output
Couldn't resolve resource vars_mixins from /path/to/component/some.component.scss
```
These errors seem to be caused by shorthand imports such as
```scss
@import 'vars_mixins';
```
and can be fixed by using absolute file paths and file extensions. However, this is not an option for style files imported from `node_modules` which will usually include shorthand imports such as the one shown above (e.g. bootstrap).

Is there any way to work around this issue? It seems that preprocessor options are only defined in `angular.json`, which means I would have to run the preprocessor step manually before running `ngc` to get this working?

### Proposed solution

Ideally there should be a way to run a simple type check with the angular CLI similar to what tools like [svelte-check](https://www.npmjs.com/package/svelte-check) achieve.

### Alternatives considered

N/A

Issues.Title: Esbuild keep reloading without project changes
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

we noticed Esbuild is very "sensitive" and reloading even when no changes where done.
for example, we have playwright tests running and at the end saving a report at the root folder (outside of src).
this report causes reloading, while its not part of the project, and not consumed by any module.

can we limit the detected parts to be only from the "src" folder?

### Minimal Reproduction

ng serve
create or save a file which is outside of the project, and not consumed by any part of the project.
see esbuild reloading

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 16.0.3
Node: 16.16.0
Package Manager: npm 8.11.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 16.0.3
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... platform-server, router

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.1600.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular      16.0.3
@angular-devkit/core               16.0.3
@angular-devkit/schematics         16.0.3
@angular/cdk                       16.0.1
@angular/flex-layout               14.0.0-beta.40
@angular/material                  15.2.9
@angular/material-moment-adapter   15.2.9
@schematics/angular                16.0.3
rxjs                               6.6.7
typescript                         4.9.5
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: fix: wrong chokidar watcher option
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?
Instead of passing the correct argument 'usePolling' to the chokidar filewatcher, 'polling' is being passed. This prevents the dev server from starting in a network drive environment and results in the error message "unknown error watch."
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: N/A

## What is the new behavior?
Chokidar is being passed the corret argument 'usePolling'.
<!-- Please describe the new behavior that. -->

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

## Other information

Issues.Title: [Drag and Drop] cdkDragHandle still ignored when it is placed inside a child component
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

As the title say, when a cdkDragHandle is used inside a child component, it's ignored and we can still drag the whole element. Also, cdkDragHandle is working correctly when defined in the same component as the cdkDrag element.

I've seen this issue: [https://github.com/angular/components/issues/13784](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/13784) but using `<ng-content>` is not an ideal solution. Also, [crisbeto](https://github.com/crisbeto) mentionned in the same issue that the Angular team was working on a fix (using a `dragRef` ?). So I don't know what exactly to do to cleanly fix this problem.

### Reproduction

[https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-t5n33x](https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-t5n33x)

### Expected Behavior

Able to move the card only using the handle.

### Actual Behavior

The card can be dragged using itself (the handle is ignored).

### Environment

Angular CLI: 14.2.10
Node: 16.10.0
Package Manager: npm 7.24.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 14.2.12
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Issues.Title: bug(table/button): Z-index and scroll issues in a sticky table
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14

### Description

I have two bugs with a sticky mat-table and not with table with mat-table directive :

- The button's z-index has changed since version 15.0.0. The sticky and button column are both 1, which makes the button visible (but not the table background), a Workaround st z-index to 2 on sticky column.
- When I have several columns in a table with a fixed column, the fixed column also moves.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link:  https://stackblitz.com/edit/tu9ax3


### Expected Behavior

That anything that scrolls under the sticky column is not visible and the sticky column is real sticky.

### Actual Behavior

The button is above the sticky column, and the sticky column is not really sticky.

### Environment

- Angular: 15 - 16
- CDK/Material: 15 - 16

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): Fix MacOS Hover feature compatibility with optgroup
Issues.Body:
Corrects ARIA semantics for the mat-optgroup component. Add role="presentation" to the label and remove aria-hidden="true" from the label.

Fix compatibility issue with MAC Hover text a11y feature angular#27080. The label of the option group does not need to be aria-hidden, and the Mac Hover text feature seems to rely on it.

Previous PR#27081 fixed this issue for legacy component. This PR fixes it for the non-legacy optgroup component.

Fix angular#27080
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/core): Fix MacOS Hover feature compatibility with optgroup" (#27239)

Issues.Title: bug(slider): Right click on a slider makes it permanently focused and unresponsive
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The issue consists of two parts:
- The focus ripple stays forever after a right click. This equally applies to one-handle and two-handle sliders
- Two-handle slider only: right click on a handle makes the other handle broken - it no longer responds to mouse events, cannot be clicked/dragged

Reproduced in v15 and v16

### Reproduction

Use the examples from the docs: https://material.angular.io/components/slider/overview#selecting-a-range
Steps to reproduce:
1. Right-click on a range (two-handle) slider. It will mark one handle as focused (ripple is displayed)
2. Close the context menu (by clicking outside)
3. Click anywhere else on the page, including other focusable elements
4. Go back to the focused slider and try to drag the other handle (which is currently not focused)


### Expected Behavior

- After (3), the focus ripple disappears from the slider.
- In (4), you can normally click/drag the slider handle

### Actual Behavior

- The slider's handle remains focused no matter what you do with the rest of the page.
- The other handle of the slider does not react to click/drag. Its interactivity only gets restored after I click on the focused handle one more time.

### Environment

- Angular: 16
- CDK/Material: 16
- Browser(s): Firefox, Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(slider): Right click on a slider makes it permanently focused and unresponsive" (#27225)

Issues.Title: bug(table & sort): Issue with sorting column passed from parent to child
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I am trying to create a component which dynamically creates a material table with sorting and I want to be able to define custom columns. The problem is that I can't seem to make sorting work with these custom columns.

What I noticed is the following:
- It is not possible to define a `mat-sort-header` in the custom columns because it requires a parent with `matSort`.
- When you create a parent with `matSort` the column with `mat-sort-header` gets "assigned" to the parent `matSort` which is different from the `matSort` in the component, that creates the dynamic table.
- Using the `register` method of `MatSort` doesn't seem to work.

I would be very grateful if you could help me a bit, because I've been quite stuck and can't seem to find a solution.

This is not exactly a bug I suppose, but I am not sure how to label it.

### Reproduction

[StackBlitz link](https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-iw33ux?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftable-wrapper-component.ts)


### Expected Behavior

The custom columns to sort.

### Actual Behavior

The custom columns won't sort.

Issues.Title: feat(Tabs): Extend Tabs customization in the mat-tab-header
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Currently, the mat tab component does not have any way to customize the contents of the `mat-tab-header` except for `mat-tab`. And there is no way to add a custom ng-content since mat-tab-header is not accessible like mat-tab-group or mat-tab.
I would like to customize mat-tab-header (which is only a viewable element in devtools and not accessible to the developer) so that I can extend the ui to look like a firefox or chrome browser tab area.
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/53593899/b7b6f98a-46a4-420f-8319-2e2cc36179e3)
As you can see in the tab area of a browser, there is obviously tabs but also buttons at the sides. For example, for chrome, there is tabs sections, the plus button, and then outside of the tabs section the dropdown menu and the minimize/max and close buttons. 

Another example is https://www.telerik.com/products/winforms/tabbedform.aspx under the Overview section or https://docs.devexpress.com/WindowsForms/115183/controls-and-libraries/forms-and-user-controls/tabbed-form

Currently the tab component looks like the top section of the below picture:
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/53593899/08efca13-d627-4636-a45a-01002c456fc4)
I'd like to be able to put components like buttons or dropdown menu in the tab component but outside of the pagination buttons  (as shown in the bottom section of the above picture)

### Use Case

Case: I would like to be able to add a button to view all the tabs in a vertical scroll down style like chrome's dropdown menu button beside the minimize button on the right. Maybe expand it even more by adding other buttons to close all tabs or other functionalities. (basically make it look like the pictures/links mentioned under the 'feature description section of this feature request.)

Currently, the workaround would be to add dropdown menu as a tab item. this is not preferred as when there is paging, that dropdown menu tab item will move as well. And it will behave like a tab item instead of a button.
In addition, the dropdown button in the tab item will also be between the two pagination buttons when it should not as the dropdown button should be stationary independent from the tab section+paging.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(Tabs): Extend Tabs customization in the mat-tab-header" (#27238)

Issues.Title: test(cdk/observers): reduce flakiness in resize observer tests
Issues.Body:
The resize observer tests have been causing some flakiness, because it's up to the browser when to fire the callback and iOS appears to be inconsistent with all other browsers.

These changes mock out the `ResizeObserver` API.

Issues.Title: bug(mat-radio-group): FormControl is always touched on server side
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I noticed a weird behaviour in my reactive forms when using Angular Universal (SSR). When a formcontrol is used with a "mat-radio-group" it will always have the state "touched" when rendered on the server. When I want to show validation messages only for form controls that were actually touched this will result in a short flicker of the validation message when loading the page initially. The same problem also occurs for "mat-slide-toggle", but not for normal input fields.

### Reproduction

Cannot include reproduction link, since this is requiring Angular universal and a node server.

Component

```
@Component({
  selector: 'page',
  templateUrl: './page.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./page.component.scss']
})
export class PageComponent extends BaseComponent {
  protected formGroup = new FormGroup({
    productKey: new FormControl<string | null>(null, Validators.required)
  });

  constructor() {
    super();
  }
}
```

HTML
```
<form [formGroup]="formGroup">
  <mat-radio-group formControlName="productKey">
    <mat-radio-button value="'A'">1</mat-radio-button>
  </mat-radio-group>
  {{ formGroup.controls.productKey.touched }}
</form>
```

### Expected Behavior

"formGroup.controls.productKey.touched" should never be "true" when the page is loaded.

### Actual Behavior

"formGroup.controls.productKey.touched" is"true" when the page is initially loaded from the server (Reloaded page, opened directly), then when the browser script is loaded it is set to false. This results in a short flicker, since the values are different. When the page is initially loaded by the browser (Through navigation) the value is false which is correct.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.4
- CDK/Material:15.0.4
- Browser(s): Chrome, Edge
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-radio-group): FormControl is always touched on server side" (#27234)

Issues.Title: Material Tabs + No Template Caching => Broken Virtual Scroll
Issues.Body:
### Description

If you attempt a ***cdkVirtualFor** with a **templateCacheSize: 0**, the Virtual Scroll will break when you include a **Material Tab** in the repeated element.

### Reproduction

[StackBlitz ](https://stackblitz.com/edit/el4pji?file=src%2Fexample%2Fcdk-virtual-scroll-template-cache-example.ts,src%2Fexample%2Fcdk-virtual-scroll-template-cache-example.html,src%2Fexample%2Fcdk-virtual-scroll-template-cache-example.css)

No broke.

### Actual Behavior

Broke.

Disable **Material Tab** pagination as so:

Issues.Title: bug(datepicker): NVDA announces entire week of dates when dialog opens
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Posting for our team's accessibility expert:

Our accessibility expert found that in NVDA 2023.1, when a user opens the datepicker dialog, the screen reader announces the entire next week of dates from the focus date. 
**We did not observe this behavior with JAWS 2023 or VoiceOver on MacOS 13.4.**

Related, turning off the default "Automatic Say All on Page Load" setting in NVDA (under Preferences > Browse Mode) does "remedy" the issue. However, our accessibility team is wary of asking users to change a default setting in NVDA for this.
Based on that, internally we have proposed this may be an NVDA problem, but we were asked to start here since NVDA is so widely used.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ahmyck
Steps to reproduce:
1. Click into the date field
2. Tab over to the dialog-open button
3. Hit enter and listen to the entire screen reader output (or check something like Speech Viewer for NVDA)

Notice the announcement of the entire next week of dates.

### Expected Behavior

Expected less verbosity and for only the focused date/cell to be announced.


### Actual Behavior

Currently, the entire next week of dates will be announced by the screen reader after the currently focused cell.

NVDA 2023.1 output (italics indicate unexpected readout):
> Choose a date  dialog
> table
> June 2, 2023  row 3  Friday  column 6
> table  with 7 rows and 7 columns  clickable  row 3  Friday  column 6  June 2, 2023  toggle button  not pressed    current date
> Choose a date
> toggle button  not pressed    current date  June 2, 2023
> _Saturday  column 7  toggle button  not pressed    June 3, 2023_
> _row 4  Sunday  column 1  toggle button  not pressed    June 4, 2023_
> _Monday  column 2  toggle button  not pressed    June 5, 2023_
> _Tuesday  column 3  toggle button  not pressed    June 6, 2023_
> _Wednesday  column 4  toggle button  not pressed    June 7, 2023_
> _Thursday  column 5  toggle button  not pressed    June 8, 2023_
> _Friday  column 6  toggle button  not pressed    June 9, 2023_
> _Saturday  column 7  toggle button  not pressed    June 10, 2023_
> _row 5  Sunday  column 1  toggle button  not pressed    June 11, 2023_

### Environment

- Angular: 13.x, 14.x, 15.x, 16.x
- CDK/Material: 13.x, 14.x, 15.x, 16.x
- Browser(s): Chrome (114), Firefox (112) 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10, Windows 11
- Screen readers: NVDA 2023.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(datepicker): NVDA announces entire week of dates when dialog opens" (#27228)

Issues.Title: bug(@angular/material): Style doesn't build with yarn pnp
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

As reported in #24128 and maybe fixed in #24536 using yarn in pnp mode means, that there is no predefined path-relation between @angular/material and @angular/cdk. Still https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/material/_theming.scss (and others) user relative paths to access cdk-files and `@forward` them.

I realize, that there is a test-case specifically for this (https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/integration/yarn-pnp-compat/), but it may be just not fully test the situation as it uses `"@angular/cdk": "file:../../dist/releases/cdk"` and `"@angular/material": "file:../../dist/releases/material",` in https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/integration/yarn-pnp-compat/package.json, thus keeping the path relation between @angular/material and @angular/cdk.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Go to a local copy of https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/integration/yarn-pnp-compat/
2. Change `package.json` to e.g. reference `"@angular/cdk": "^16.0.3"` and `"@angular/material": "^16.0.3"`
3. Run `yarn install`
4. Add `@import '@angular/material/theming';` as second line to `src/styles.scss`
5. Run `yarn run build`


### Expected Behavior

This should build

### Actual Behavior

```text
â¯ yarn run build
Workspace extension with invalid name (defaultProject) found.
â ‹ Generating browser application bundles (phase: setup)...    TypeScript compiler options "target" and "useDefineForClassFields" are set to "ES2022" and "false" respectively by the Angular CLI. To control ECMA version and features use the Browerslist configuration. For more information, see https://angular.io/guide/build#configuring-browser-compatibility
    NOTE: You can set the "target" to "ES2022" in the project's tsconfig to remove this warning.
âœ” Browser application bundle generation complete.

SassError: Can't find stylesheet to import.
  â•·

  â”‚ ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  â•µ

./src/styles.scss?ngGlobalStyle - Error: Module build failed (from ./.yarn/__virtual__/mini-css-extract-plugin-virtual-c5c86c3c0c/0/cache/mini-css-extract-plugin-npm-2.7.5-7e01d66430-afc37cdfb7.zip/node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/loader.js):
```
